results.title: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.creator_credit: Thomas Ladgrove and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. He eventually started working with the loom and became the youngest weaver in Australia and England at age 18. He describes his work on the loom as well as staff morale when it became clear that Brintons was suffering, the subsequent rumours and worry and then the closure when the announcement to cease operations was made.

results.title: The Longhouse people
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The life and religious ceremonies of the Longhouse people - Iriquois Indians who adhere to the old religion. We see how the Iroquois of today, although fully adapted to the ways of the white people, still maintain a link with their proud past through observance of the customs and beliefs of their forefathers. Highlights of the film show an outdoor dance in supplication for rain, a healing ceremony performed by men of the False-Face Society and a dance in celebration of a newly chosen chief.

results.title: The Longest day
results.creator_credit: Gerd Oswald, Bernhard Wicki, Ken Annakin, Andrew Marton, Darryl F. Zanuck, Darryl F Zanuck Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Cornelius Ryan’s compilation of interviews with D Day survivors, the film is broken into three sections- the Allied preparations for invasion, a faithful recreation of the movement of an Armada across the English Channel, and culminating in the attack on Normandy beaches. Intercut with these sequences is the response by German soldiers which are subtitled and directed by Bernhard Wicki. One of the most ambitious war films ever made, ‘The Longest day’ features 48 international stars, 4 directors, and won 2 Academy Awards for Special Effects and Cinematography, and was nominated for Best Picture.

A film of importance to mature men and women who may wish to offer their services as volunteers. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: The Long walk of Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Clifford Bestall, Indra de Langerolle, David Fanning, Unapix Entertainment Productions, LLC and Story Street Productions
results.brief_description: This is an intimate portrait of one of the century’s greatest leaders told by those who have known and shared the more important moments of his life. However it is not just a narrative of Mandela’s life, its purpose is to examine how Mandela has risen above his very public personal trials and kept his eye unflinchingly on a distant and noble goal. Mandela’s life story and achievements are told through interviews with his contemporaries and friends and the use of archival footage.

results.title: The Long view
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The view from space has given us a total vision of our planet—a perspective and perception made possible through the development of remote-sensing technology in connection with Earth-orbiting satellites and aircraft. This film details some of the practical, down-to-earth applications of this technology and Canada’s activity in this field, particularly where it concerns the better management of natural resources and the environment. The capabilities are astonishing, and the need for responsible conservation is explicitly stated.

results.title: The Long riders [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Tim Zinnemann, United Artists Corporation and Huka Productions
results.brief_description: Walter Hill’s version of the infamous James-Younger gang, an outlaw group of veterans who terrorised Missouri and Minnesota in the immediate post-Civil War years, is a homage to the archetypal classic Westerns of Hollywood’s Classic era. The James-Younger Gang consisted of three sets of siblings (Jesse and Frank James, Cole, Jim and Bob Younger, and Ed and Clell Miller) and it is Walter Hill’s conceit with “The Long Riders” to have three sets of Hollywood siblings play the gang members (James and Stacy Keach play the James’; David, Keith and Robert Carradine are the Youngers; Randy and Dennis Quaid, the Millers). It can be seen that in many respects “The Long Riders”, made at the beginning of the 1980s, inaugurated Hollywood’s obsession in that decade for pastiche and uncritical homage as opposed to the revisionism of genre that dominated the American cinema of the early seventies. Beautifully shot by cinematographer Ric Waite, who uses the lush southern United States locales to recall the mythological terrain of the John Ford westerns, and featuring original music by Ry Cooder which is faithful to the musical legacy of the United States Civil War, “The Long Riders” is, for all the directness of its violence, language and sexual lives of the gang, very much a traditional western. Cast also includes Christopher Guest and Nicholas Guest as Charlie and Bob Ford respectively, Pamela Reed, Amy Stryker.

results.title: The Long line
results.creator_credit: Arnold Rabin, United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: This film is a comprehensive and dramatic account of the whole of the refugee problem. It includes sequences showing the escape of refugees across the Hungarian border, their experiences in camp and their final resettlement in their own homes. It also tells of the appointment of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the formation of his office to handle refugee problems.
